data.title: Iceland Holds Rates at 9.25% as Inflation Remains Stubborn
data.meta_description: Iceland’s central bank kept interest rates at the highest level in Western Europe as its work to tame inflation continues even as the economy is cooling.
data.text:
Iceland’s central bank kept interest rates at the highest level in Western Europe as its work to tame inflation continues even as the economy is cooling.

Policymakers at Sedlabanki left the 7-day term deposit rate at 9.25% on Wednesday, the highest level since December 2009. Borrowing costs have been held unchanged since August.
